fieldRationales.expandedReason: The issue describes gestures 'not working' but provides no error messages, stack traces, or specific broken behavior. It reads as a usage question about how to combine pinch/pan gestures with SkiaSharp touch handling on Android.

alternatives.whyRejected: No error output, stack trace, or clear description of expected vs actual behavior. More likely a gesture conflict or usage issue than a SkiaSharp bug.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: The issue specifically involves SKCanvasView in Xamarin.Forms with gesture recognizers, which is in the SkiaSharp.Views.Forms package.
Title explicitly states the issue is Android-specific. Gesture handling differences between Android and iOS are well-known in Xamarin.Forms.

Xamarin.Forms is deprecated. The issue is 7+ years old with no maintainer engagement. Users should migrate to .NET MAUI where gesture handling has been redesigned.

resolution.hypothesis: The user wants pinch and pan gestures to work alongside SkiaSharp touch handling on Android. The likely cause is gesture conflict between Xamarin.Forms gesture recognizers and SkiaSharp's native touch handling.

proposals.description: In the Xamarin.Forms era, using SKTouchEffect directly on the SKCanvasView instead of combining with Forms GestureRecognizers avoids the Android gesture conflict. Handle pinch/pan logic manually from touch events.

payload.draftBody:
Closing this issue as Xamarin.Forms has been [deprecated and archived](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/platform/support/policy/xamarin) in favor of .NET MAUI.

If you're still experiencing gesture issues with SkiaSharp, please try migrating to **SkiaSharp.Views.Maui** which has improved touch and gesture handling integration. The `SKTouchEffect` approach in MAUI handles the Android gesture conflicts better.

If the issue persists on MAUI, please open a new issue with a reproduction project targeting the current platform.

actions.description: Close as not planned — platform deprecated, stale
